content.question: The graph of a twice-differentiable function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is shown for <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> has a horizontal tangent at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and points of inflection at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="x equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>. On what intervals do <math alttext="f prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> have the same sign?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> only
<math alttext="2 is less than x, which is less than 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="2 is less than x, which is less than 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="1 is less than x, which is less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3 is less than x, which is less than 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="2 is less than x, which is less than 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
